Pre-requisite: Students must have completed Chinese 211-3 or Chinese 214-0 with a minimum grade of C- to enroll in this course.
title: WCAS CHINESE 312-0-20 Chinese IV: Chinese in Business Practice II

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is designed as the continuation of Chinese 214 in order to complete the training of basic Business Chinese. In addition to introducing more Chinese business lexicons and more language styles used in Chinese business culture, this course features training students to engage more in tasks that are relatively complicated and crucial to corporate operations, such as conducting market research, discussing marketing strategy and investment environment, dealing with disputes, producing formal business correspondence and business report, negotiation, etc.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Students must pass Chinese 211-3 or 214-0 with a final course grade of C- or above, or have passed the placement test, to take this course.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Students will improve their command of advanced vocabulary and the formality of Chinese necessary for professional work settings through business report, simulated projects, role-plays, etc. This course integrates the study of language, cross-cultural awareness, and professional interaction.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Attendance, classroom participation, daily homework, written exam, oral exam (presentations and skits), final project
